clinical_study.brief_title: Hypertension Control and Remote Blood Pressure Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Hypertension Control and Remote Blood Pressure Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: We will perform a pilot study of the new time-to-control measure's responsiveness to more intensive blood pressure monitoring and intervention. This pilot will provide a subset of uncontrolled hypertensive patients with home blood pressure monitors linked to the electronic medical record (EMR) at Cedars-Sinai. This information will be monitored and acted upon weekly, allowing for a more rapid titration of medical therapy. A decrease in the time-to-control measure of blood pressure management would be a preliminary finding consistent with measure responsiveness.

primary_outcome.description: Time from initiation of remote monitoring to control of BP, as defined by the 2017 American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association (ACC/AHA) Guidelines

arm_group.description: Patients with uncontrolled hypertension provided with a remote BP monitor linked to their electronic health record.

intervention.description: Remote BP monitor linked to patient's electronic health record. This is a process of care study assessing remote BP monitoring.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age >18 years at any time during the study period
2. Patients with blood pressure recordings in the EMR
3. At least 2 outpatient clinic visits in a 12-month period
4. Patients must have a smartphone compatible with My CSLink, the Cedars-Sinai mobile health application (any smartphone running iOS or Android operating software)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with no blood pressure recordings in the EMR
2. Patient unwilling to sign up for My CSLink mobile health application
3. Inability to use a home blood pressure cuff
